Verhoeven, Gerrit. “Grand Tour.” The Oxford Handbook of the History of Tourism and Travel, edited by Eric Zuelow, and Kevin J. James, C5.P1–C5.N60. Oxford: Oxford Academic Online, 2022. https://doi.org/10.1093/oxfordhb/9780190889555.013.5.

Verri, Pietro. Considerazioni sul commercio dello stato di Milano. Edited by Carlo Antonio Vianello. Milan: Università L. Bocconi, 1939.

———. “Considerazioni sulla proposizione di restringere il lusso nello stato di Milano 1763.” In Edizione nazionale delle opere di Pietro Verri. Vol. 2, Scritti di economia finanza e amministrazione, edited by Giuseppe Bognetti et al, 93–106. Rome: Edizioni storia e letteratura, 2007.

Verstegan, Richard. The Posts of the World. London: Richard Rowlands, 1576.

Vickers, Michael. The Arundel and Pomfret Marbles in Oxford. Oxford: Ashmolean Museum, 2006.

Walchester, Kathryn. Travelling Servants: Mobility and Employment in British Travel Writing 1750–1850. New York: Routledge, 2020.

Warren, Christopher N. “Historiography’s Two Voices: Data Infrastructure and History at Scale in the Oxford Dictionary of National Biography (ODNB).” Journal of Cultural Analytics 3, no. 1 (2018). https://doi.org/10.22148/16.028.

Weaver, Stewart A. Exploration: A Very Short Introduction. Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2014.

Weber, Alan, ed. Because It’s There: A Celebration of Mountaineering from 200 B.C. to Today. Lanham: Taylor Trade, 2003.

West, Shearer. “Gender and Internationalism: The Case of Rosalba Carriera.” In Italian Culture in Northern Europe in the Eighteenth Century, edited by Shearer West, 87–104. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1999.

Weston-Lewis, Aidan, and Fabrizia Spirito, eds. Giovanni Battista Lusieri and the Panoramic Landscape: Expanding Horizons. Edinburgh: National Galleries of Scotland, 2012.

Whistler, Catherine. “Rosalba Carriera e il mondo britannico.” In Pavanello, Rosalba Carriera (1673–1757), 181–206.

White, Richard. “What Is Spatial History?” Stanford University Spatial History Project, Spatial History Lab, Working Paper, 2010.

Wilton, Andrew, and Ilaria Bignamini, eds. Grand Tour: The Lure of Italy in the Eighteenth Century. London: Tate Gallery, 1996.

Wilton-Ely, John. Piranesi, Paestum, & Sloane. Munich/New York: Prestel, 2013.

———. The Mind and Art of Giovanni Battista Piranesi. London: Thames and Hudson, 1978.

Winckelmann, Johann Joachim. History of the Art of Antiquity. Translated by Harry Francis Mallgrave. Los Angeles: Getty Research Institute, 2006.

Windham, William. Two Letters from an English Gentleman Giving an Account of . . . the Ice Alps in Savoy. London: Peter Martell, 1744.

Wold, Helge A. Querinis reise—Il viaggio di Querini. Stamsund, Norway: Orkana, 2004.

Woloch, Alex. The One vs. the Many: Minor Characters and the Space of the Protagonist in the Novel. Princeton: Princeton University Press, 2003.

Wood, Alfred C. A History of the Levant Company. London: Routledge, 2006. First published 1935 by Oxford University Press.

Wood, Karl E. Health and Hazard: Spa Culture and the Social History of Medicine in the Nineteenth Century. Newcastle upon Tyne: Cambridge Scholars, 2012.

Woolf, Greg. Rome: An Empire’s Story. Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2012.

Woolf, Virginia. “The Art of Biography.” The Atlantic (April 1939): 506–10. https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/1939/04/the-art-of-biography/654067/

The Yale Edition of Horace Walpole’s Correspondence. Edited by Wilmarth Sheldon Lewis. 48 vols. New Haven, CT: Yale University Press, 1937–83.

Zaugg, Roberto. Stranieri di antico regime. Mercanti, giudici e consoli nella Napoli del Settecento. Viella, Italy: Roma, 2011.
